responses: Hey there! Ready to explore the world of engineering?
Hi! What brings you to GCECT’s digital doorstep today?
GCECT stands for Government College of Engineering & Ceramic Technology. Established in 1941, it’s older than most of your professors and still going strong!

patterns: What is the contact number of GCECT?
responses: You can call us at 033-2370 1263, or if you prefer writing over talking, drop an email at principal.gcect@gcect.ac.in. Just don’t expect an instant reply—professors are busy people!
GCECT offers B.Tech in Ceramic Technology, Information Technology, and Computer Science & Engineering. For the brave souls who love research, we have M.Tech and Ph.D. programs too!

patterns: How to get admission in GCECT?
responses: Getting in is simple: ace WBJEE for B.Tech or GATE for M.Tech. Or, you know, invent something groundbreaking and get an honorary admission (just kidding, don’t quote me on that).
Exams are like taxes—inevitable and stressful. Check the latest notices on our website and brace yourself!
Yes, hostel life is an experience you won’t forget—good food, great friends, and occasional power cuts for that true ‘survival mode’ feel. Apply early to grab a spot!
Yes, our library is stocked with enough books to build a fort. It’s open from 9 AM to 6 PM, so no excuses for missing your research deadlines!

patterns: How is the food in the canteen?
responses: The canteen food is a surprise every day—sometimes delightful, sometimes a test of your willpower. But hey, it’s affordable and fills you up!
Yes! From cricket to chess, we have it all. If running to class before the professor shuts the door was a sport, we’d have Olympic-level champions!

patterns: What festivals are celebrated at GCECT?
responses: From technical fests to cultural nights, GCECT has it all. Just make sure to attend—free food and fun are guaranteed!
Goodbye! Don’t forget to come back—I promise I won’t give you homework!
See you later! And remember, caffeine is your best friend during exams.
